body.p: The syllable matcher, denoted by the small character sigma σ (Unicode character U+03C3), will match a syllable, or the remainder of a syllable. Data must be correctly syllabified (see ) for this operation to work correctly. To type the syllable matcher in expressions, use the autocomplete feature available by pressing Tab inside phonex input fields. This matcher cannot backtrack, but a constituent range may be specified.

A range of syllable constituent types may be specified to restrict the portion of the syllable matched. The range of contituent types is specified using the following syntax:σ/X..Y/Where X and Y are single character consituent type ids from the list:
S - syllable stress
L - left appendix
O - onset (include OEHS)
N - nucleus
C - coda
R - right appendix

Examples:
Match a single syllable (including stress):σ
Match one or more syllables (i.e., any word):σ+
Match a syllable which begins with one or more onsets, here the syllable matcher takes on the 'remainder of' action and will match all phones from the syllable rhyme.\c:O+σ
Below is the same expression with named groups 'O' and 'R' assigned to the portions of the syllable which are matched by each element in the expression:(O=\c:O+) (R=σ)
Match a syllable which ends with one or more codas. This demonstrates the use of constituent range to match a portion of the syllable starting with the stress marker and ending with the nucleus:σ/S..N/\c:C+
